quickbar_toggle.name: Toggle QuickBar
quickbar_toggle.description: Open or close a QuickBar overlay by alias.

device_id.name: Target TV (optional)
device_id.description: Target a specific QuickBars device. If omitted, broadcasts to all connected QuickBars devices.

alias.name: Alias
alias.description: The QuickBar alias defined in the TV app.

camera_toggle.name: Show camera (PiP)
camera_toggle.description: Show or hide a picture-in-picture camera overlay on the TV. Provide either a QuickBars camera alias or a Home Assistant camera entity (with MJPEG URL). You may also provide a direct RTSP URL.

device_id.name: Target TV (optional)
device_id.description: Target a specific QuickBars device. If omitted, broadcasts to all connected QuickBars devices.

camera_alias.name: Camera alias (QuickBars)
camera_alias.description: Camera alias as configured in the QuickBars TV app (Manage Saved Entities). Use this or camera_entity.

camera_entity.name: Camera entity
camera_entity.description: Home Assistant camera entity that is imported into the QuickBars TV app and has an MJPEG URL. Use this or camera_alias.

rtsp_url.name: RTSP URL (optional)
rtsp_url.description: Direct RTSP URL (e.g., rtsp://user:pass@host:554/path). If provided with camera_entity/alias, RTSP is preferred for this request. You may also use only rtsp_url (no entity/alias). Use rtsp:// (rtsps:// not supported). Credentials with special characters like @ or : are handled automatically.

size.name: Size preset
size.description: small, medium, or large. If omitted, uses the camera's saved default.

size_px.name: Custom size (pixels)
size_px.description: Object with width/height, for example: {"w":640,"h":360}. Use instead of size.

position.name: Position
position.description: Screen corner: top_left, top_right, bottom_left, or bottom_right.

show_title.name: Show camera title
show_title.description: true/false. If omitted, uses the saved setting in the TV app.

auto_hide.name: Auto-hide (seconds)
auto_hide.description: Seconds before the overlay hides. 0 = never (requires manual toggle). If omitted, uses the app default.

notify.name: Send notification (TV)
notify.description: Display a rich notification on the TV with optional title, icon, image, sound, and action buttons.

device_id.name: Target TV (optional)
device_id.description: Target a specific QuickBars device. If omitted, broadcasts to all connected QuickBars devices.

message.name: Message
message.description: Main text content of the notification.

actions.name: Actions
actions.description: List of action objects: { id, label }.

length.name: Length (seconds)
length.description: How long to show the notification. Default 6.

mdi_icon.name: Icon
mdi_icon.description: MDI icon near the title (e.g., mdi:bell).

image.name: Image source
image.description: Provide an image via url (https://example.com/pic.jpg), path (relative to `/config/www`), or media_id. Choose any of the 3 options, or `image_media`.

image_media.name: Image (Media Browser)
image_media.description: Select an image directly from Home Assistant's Media Browser.

sound.name: Sound
sound.description: Provide a sound via url (https://example.com/file.mp3), path (relative to `/config/www`), or media_id. Choose any of the 3 options, or `sound_media`.

sound_media.name: Sound (Media Browser)
sound_media.description: Select a sound directly from Home Assistant's Media Browser.

sound_volume_percent.name: Sound volume (%)
sound_volume_percent.description: 0â€“200. 100 = TV system volume; >100 uses software boost and may distort.

interrupt.name: Interrupt
interrupt.description: If true, replaces any currently visible notification immediately.

position.name: Position
position.description: top_left, top_right, bottom_left, or bottom_right. Default top_right.
